prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1875, 0.0001] Next, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following loops and lines: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.375] + Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. After creating the sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrude depth towards the normal should be 0.0937 units and the extrude depth opposite the normal should also be 0.0937 units. This will create a new solid body for the prism. Part 2: Construct a thin rectangle on top of the prism from Part 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1875, 0.0] Next, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following loops and lines: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.017] + Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.017], End Point [0.7483, 0.017] + Line 4: Start Point [0.7483, 0.017], End Point [0.0269, 0.017] + Line 5: Start Point [0.0269, 0.017], End Point [0.0, 0.017] + Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.017], End Point [0.0, 0.0] + Line 7: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.017] The rectangle has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.0066 units, and a height of 0.0033 units. After creating the sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrude depth towards the normal should be 0.0033 units and the extrude depth opposite the normal should also be 0.0033 units. This will join the new solid body for the rectangle with the prism from Part 1.</description>
